alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 9:05PM CDT until October 27 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Johnson County. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Mansfield, Burleson, Cleburne, Crowley, Keene, Joshua, Alvarado, Rendon, Venus, Grandview, Godley, Cross Timber, Lake Pat Cleburne, Cleburne State Park, Lake Whitney, Parker, Rio Vista, Cresson and Briaroaks.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
